objective: Early Baroque- 1600-1640) -Homophonic texture, dissonance. Middle Baroque” 1640-1680- Major and minor tonality established forming basis of compositions; Emphasis on instrumental music. Late Baroque- (1680-1750 ) Ornamented and elaborate Abundance of Polyphony, often dense textures. Dominant to tonic chord relationship established. Clear triads; seventh chords, diminished triads.
content: Henry Purcell (1659- 1695) Antonio Vivaldi (1678- 1741) Johann S Bach 1685- 1750 George F Handel (1685- 1759

objective: Development of the orchestra and instruments- mainly strings, flute and bassoon. Accompaniment by the bass continuo or figured bass played by harpsichord or organ; cello or bassoon accompanying instruments One basic mood expressed in instrumental music. Main keyboard instruments- organ, harpsichord. Dynamics generally sudden (terraced dynamics). Continuous and expansive melody.
content: Cantata No. 140: Awake a Voice is Calling Us. Handel’s Music for the Royal fireworks The Messiah,” Hallelujah Chorus” For Unto Us a Child is Born

section:
section of: a piece
of music
objective: Simplification of ornamentation. Tuneful melodies and simple harmonies. Contrasts in mood and theme. Less dense textures to more homophonic with greater flexibility. Balanced form and symmetrical phrases in structure. Variety of rhythmic patterns to include unexpected pauses, syncopations frequent changes from long notes to shorter notes. Gradual dynamic shading to include frequent crescendos and decrescendos. The Piano replaces harpsichord. An expanded orchestra- greater variety of tone colour.
content: Joseph Haydn (1732- 1809) Wolfgang A Mozart (1756-1791) Ludwig V Beethoven ( 1770-1827)
specific_objectives: theme. Less dense textures to more homophonic with greater flexibility. Balanced form

symmetrical phrases in structure. Variety of rhythmic patterns to include unexpected pauses, syncopations frequent changes from long notes to shorter notes. Gradual dynamic shading to include frequent crescendos
decrescendos. The Piano replaces harpsichord. An expanded orchestra- greater variety of tone colour.
content_items: Joseph Haydn (1732- 1809) Wolfgang A Mozart (1756-1791) Ludwig V Beethoven ( 1770-1827)

objective: PROJECT ONE – LIAP I MUSICAL PERFORMANCE
content: Record on a readily available and easily portable storage device the music (20-30 minutes in duration) presented in a live performance. Compare and contrast the structural and expressive elements and comment on the socio-cultural significance of the music. MAIN TASK: Analyse the music heard in a live performance.
specific_objectives: PROJECT ONE – LIAP I MUSICAL PERFORMANCE

comment on the socio-cultural significance of the music. MAIN TASK: Analyse the music heard in a live performance.

section:
section of: a piece
of music
content: Investigate the music of a prominent Caribbean performer or composer by interviewing the artiste to gain information on career development, influences, method and mode of performing or composing and achievements. Record on a readily available and easily portable storage device works (10-20 minutes in duration) by this performer or composer. Analyse the music in terms of structural and expressive elements and comment on its socio- cultural significance. MAIN TASK: Analyse the music of a (living) Caribbean performer/composer.
content_items: Investigate the music of a prominent Caribbean performer or composer by interviewing the artiste to gain information on career development, influences, method
